chartDetail.title: Chart Details
chartDetail.generatingDesc: We are calculating planetary positions and generating astrological interpretations.
chartDetail.birthChartDesc: Complete visualization of your birth sky

bigThree.title: The Big Three
bigThree.sunTooltip: The Sun represents your core identity, life purpose and vitality. It is the nucleus of your conscious personality.
bigThree.moonTooltip: The Moon represents your emotions, instinctive needs and unconscious reactions. It reveals how you feel safe and comfortable.
bigThree.ascTooltip: The Ascendant is the sign that was rising on the eastern horizon at your birth. It represents your social mask and first impression.

chartDetail.planetPositionsTooltip: Exact planetary positions calculated with Swiss Ephemeris (precision < 1 arcsecond). Includes longitude, latitude, speed and retrograde state.
chartDetail.astroHousesTooltip: The 12 houses divide the sky into sectors representing life areas. System used: {{system}}. Each house has a cusp (beginning) and a planetary ruler.
chartDetail.planetaryAspectsTooltip: Aspects are geometric angles between planets that reveal how they interact. We detect major aspects (conjunction, opposition, trine, square, sextile) and minor (quincunx, semisextile, etc.) with configurable orbs.
chartDetail.arabicPartsTooltip: Arabic Parts (or Lots) are mathematically calculated points from planetary positions. They reveal specific life themes according to Hellenistic tradition.
chartDetail.arabicPartsDesc: Sensitive points from Hellenistic astrological tradition

arabicParts.whatAreDesc: Arabic Parts (also called 'Lots' in Hellenistic tradition) are mathematically calculated points from planetary and angular positions. They function as 'virtual planets', revealing specific life themes.
arabicParts.formulaDesc: Part = Ascendant + Planet1 - Planet2 (all in degrees 0-360). Formulas differ between day charts (â˜€ï¸ Sun above horizon) and night charts (ðŸŒ™ Sun below horizon).
arabicParts.importanceDesc: The house where a Part falls and the aspects it receives from natal planets are significant. The Lot of Fortune is especially important - medieval astrologers treated it with the same importance as the Ascendant.
arabicParts.originDesc: Developed in Hellenistic astrology (Greece/Rome, 100 BC - 600 AD) and expanded by medieval Arab astrologers (700-1400 AD). There are hundreds of cataloged Parts, but the 4 presented here are the most fundamental.
arabicParts.technicalNoteDesc: Your chart is {{sect}} ({{sectDesc}}), so the formulas used follow the sect rules of Hellenistic tradition.
arabicParts.notAvailable: Arabic Parts not available for this chart.
arabicParts.willBeCalculated: Parts will be automatically calculated for charts created or updated after this feature.

errors.processError: An error occurred while processing your birth chart.

planetList.dignitiesDescription: Essential dignities show a planet's strength in a given sign, based on traditional astrology.
planetList.domicileDesc: Planet in the sign it rules (+5)
planetList.scoreInfo: Positive score indicates strong planet. Negative score indicates debilitation.
planetList.lordOfNativityTitle: Lord of the Nativity - highest essential dignity
planetList.classicalNote: Showing only the 7 classical planets of traditional astrology
planetList.interpretationsDesc: AI-generated based on traditional astrology principles (essential dignities, sect). Focus on the 7 classical planets.

houseTable.interpretationsDesc: AI-generated based on traditional astrology principles. Interpretations consider the sign on the cusp and meaning of each house.

aspectGrid.orbDesc: Distance from exact aspect. Smaller orbs indicate stronger aspects.
aspectGrid.interpretationsDesc: AI-generated based on traditional astrology principles. Interpretations consider the nature of the aspect and planets involved.

arabicParts.fortuneTooltip: The most important of the Arabic Parts. Represents the physical body, vital health and material wealth that "comes to us". In Hellenistic tradition, it's calculated from Sun, Moon and Ascendant.
arabicParts.spiritTooltip: Complementary to Part of Fortune. Represents the mind, intellect and what we "make happen" through conscious actions. It's the inverse formula of Fortune.
arabicParts.erosTooltip: Represents romantic love, erotic desire and passion. Complements Venus analysis, revealing how we experience love and attraction.
arabicParts.necessityTooltip: Represents inevitable restrictions, karma and life lessons. Indicates areas where we face necessary difficulties for our development.

lunarPhase.note: The lunar phase at birth reveals patterns about temperament, life cycle and how you process emotional experiences.

temperament.title: Temperament
temperament.note: Temperament is determined by the sum of elemental qualities (Hot, Cold, Wet, Dry) from 5 factors of the natal chart: Ascendant, Ascendant Ruler, Solar Quadrant, Lunar Phase and Lord of the Nativity, following medieval astrology tradition.

sect.title: Sect Analysis
sect.description: Classification of planets according to diurnal/nocturnal rules
sect.diurnalDesc: â˜€ï¸ Birth during the day - Sun above the horizon. Diurnal planets (Sun, Jupiter, Saturn) work better in this chart.
sect.nocturnalDesc: ðŸŒ™ Birth during the night - Sun below the horizon. Nocturnal planets (Moon, Venus, Mars) work better in this chart.
sect.beneficsDesc: Jupiter and Venus - naturally helpful planets
sect.maleficsDesc: Saturn and Mars - challenging but necessary planets
sect.beneficOutOfSectDesc: {{planet}} in {{sign}} still helps, but may overdo it - indulgence.
sect.maleficOutOfSectDesc: {{planet}} in {{sign}} is more challenging - requires special attention.
sect.allPlanetsDesc: Classification of each planet according to sect rules
sect.whatIsSectDesc: In traditional astrology, charts are divided into diurnal (day) and nocturnal (night) based on the Sun's position. Planets work better when they are "in sect" - aligned with the chart type.
sect.beneficsInSectEffect: (Jupiter in day, Venus in night) are more generous and balanced
sect.beneficsOutOfSectEffect: still help, but may overdo or be less effective
sect.maleficsInSectEffect: (Saturn in day, Mars in night) challenge constructively
sect.maleficsOutOfSectEffect: are harder to integrate and can be more destructive
sect.howToUseDesc: Pay special attention to your out-of-sect malefics - these are areas that need more conscious work. Your in-sect benefics are natural resources you can leverage.

security.encryption: All your data is protected with end-to-end SSL/TLS encryption during transmission and storage. We use the highest industry security standards.

security.control: You have total control over your data: access, correction, deletion and portability guaranteed by law. Your birth data is never shared with third parties.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get your questions answered about Real Astrology
faq.a1: A birth chart (or natal chart) is a graphical representation of the positions of planets, signs and astrological houses at the exact moment of your birth. It reveals potentials, personal characteristics and life trends based on traditional astrology.
faq.q2: Do I need to know the exact time of my birth?
faq.a2: Yes, the exact time is fundamental for precise calculations, especially to determine the Ascendant and house positions. A difference of just 4 minutes can alter the Ascendant. If you don't know it, check your birth certificate or hospital records.
faq.q3: How do you calculate the birth chart?
faq.a3: We use Swiss Ephemeris with NASA's JPL DE431 ephemeris, ensuring astronomical precision greater than 0.001Â°. Our algorithms calculate planetary positions, astrological houses (multiple systems), aspects between planets and sensitive points like lunar nodes and Arabic parts.
faq.a4: Yes! We use end-to-end SSL/TLS encryption, secure storage and are 100% compliant with LGPD and GDPR. Your data is never shared with third parties. You have total control: you can access, correct or delete your data at any time.
faq.q5: Can I create birth charts for other people?
faq.a5: Yes! You can create as many birth charts as you want - for friends, family, clients (if you're a professional astrologer), historical figures, etc. There's no limit on charts created. Just enter the correct birth data.
faq.a6: Yes, completely free! You can create unlimited birth charts, view professional graphics, access AI interpretations and export PDFs without paying anything. No hidden fees, trial periods or limitations. It's free forever.
faq.q7: Do AI interpretations replace a professional astrologer?
faq.a7: No. AI-generated interpretations are an excellent starting point for studying your chart, but they don't replace the in-depth analysis of a qualified professional astrologer. Use our AI as a learning and self-knowledge tool, but consider consulting a specialist for complex analyses or specific questions.
faq.a8: Dark Mode can be activated manually through the theme button in the interface, or configured to automatically follow your operating system preferences. Ideal for night use, it reduces eye strain and saves battery on devices with OLED screens.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using Real Astrology ("Service", "Platform", "we"), you ("User", "you") agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, do not use our Service.

description.title: 2. Service Description
description.intro: Real Astrology is a digital platform that provides:
description.item1: Birth chart calculations using precise astronomical data (Swiss Ephemeris)
description.item3: Astrological interpretations based on traditional methods
description.item4: Secure storage of personal birth data

account.title: 3. User Registration and Account
account.req1: You must be at least 18 years old
account.req2: Provide true, complete, and up-to-date information
account.req3: Maintain the confidentiality of your access credentials
account.resp1: You are responsible for all activities on your account
account.resp2: Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use
account.resp3: Do not share your credentials with third parties

acceptableUse.title: 4. Acceptable Use
acceptableUse.can1: Create birth charts for personal or professional use
acceptableUse.can2: Share exported charts following our guidelines
acceptableUse.can3: Use the services for educational purposes
acceptableUse.cannot1: Use the Service for illegal or unauthorized purposes
acceptableUse.cannot2: Attempt to access restricted areas of the system
acceptableUse.cannot3: Reverse engineer, decompile, or modify our software
acceptableUse.cannot4: Collect data from other users without consent

intellectualProperty.title: 5. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The code, design, algorithms, and content of Real Astrology are our property. You receive a limited, non-exclusive, revocable license to use the Service.

privacy.title: 6. Privacy and Data Protection
privacy.content: We comply with LGPD (Brazil's General Data Protection Law) and GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation).
privacy.seePolicy: For more details, see our <link>Privacy Policy</link>.
privacy.access: Access: download all your data (JSON export)
privacy.deletion: Deletion: request complete removal (right to be forgotten)
privacy.portability: Portability: export data in structured format

limitations.title: 7. Limitations and Warranties
limitations.content: Birth charts are generated for educational and entertainment purposes. They do not replace medical, psychological, legal, or financial advice.

modifications.title: 8. Modifications to Terms
modifications.content: We may update these Terms periodically. We will notify you of significant changes by email or dashboard notification.

law.title: 9. Applicable Law
law.content: These Terms are governed by the laws of Brazil. Jurisdiction: SÃ£o Paulo/SP Court.

intro.title: 1. Introduction
intro.content: Real Astrology respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information in accordance with LGPD (Law 13.709/2018) and GDPR (EU Regulation 2016/679).

what.title: 1. What are Cookies?
what.content: Cookies are small text files stored in your browser when you visit a website. They allow the site to "remember" you between visits, improving your experience.

types.title: 2. Cookies We Use
types.essentialDesc: These cookies are strictly necessary and cannot be disabled:
types.functionalDesc: Improve your experience but can be disabled:
types.analyticalDesc: We use them to understand how you use the site (anonymized data):
types.marketingDesc: Currently, we do not use advertising, remarketing, or third-party tracking cookies (Facebook Pixel, Google Ads, etc.).

thirdParty.title: 3. Third-Party Cookies
thirdParty.oauthDesc: When logging in via Google, GitHub, or Facebook, these services may set their own cookies:

hero.title: Traditional Astrology with Astronomical Precision
hero.subtitle: Discover how we combine millennia-old classical astrology techniques with cutting-edge astronomical calculation technology to offer precise and reliable birth charts.

traditional.title: Traditional Astrology
traditional.subtitle: Classical techniques validated by centuries of practice
traditional.desc1: Traditional Astrology describes astrological practices developed in classical antiquity (Greece and Rome) and refined during the Middle Ages and Renaissance. Unlike modern astrology (post-20th century), which emphasizes psychological aspects and self-knowledge, traditional astrology is objective, predictive, and based on planetary dignities.
traditional.desc2: Our platform implements techniques from Hellenistic Astrology (Greco-Roman period, 100 BC - 600 AD) and Medieval Astrology (European and Arab medieval period, 700 AD - 1700 AD), following texts from classical authors such as Ptolemy, Vettius Valens, Dorotheus of Sidon, Abu Ma'shar, and William Lilly.

dignities.title: 1. Essential Dignities
dignities.desc: Scoring system that evaluates a planet's strength and quality in a sign:
dignities.domicile: Domicile (+5): Planet in its own sign (e.g., Mars in Aries)
dignities.exaltation: Exaltation (+4): Planet in its exaltation sign (e.g., Sun in Aries)
dignities.triplicity: Triplicity (+3): Planet ruling the sign's element
dignities.term: Term (+2): Planet has dominion over specific degrees
dignities.face: Face (+1): Planet governs decan (10Â°) of the sign
dignities.peregrine: Peregrine (0): Planet without dignities or debilities
dignities.detriment: Detriment (-5): Planet in the sign opposite its domicile
dignities.fall: Fall (-4): Planet in the sign opposite its exaltation

sect.title: 2. Sect Analysis (Day/Night)
sect.desc: We determine if the chart is diurnal (Sun above horizon) or nocturnal (Sun below horizon). Planets are classified as:
sect.diurnal: Diurnal: Sun, Jupiter, Saturn (better performance in diurnal charts)
sect.nocturnal: Nocturnal: Moon, Venus, Mars (better performance in nocturnal charts)
sect.note: Planets in sect (aligned with chart type) express themselves more harmoniously. Malefics out of sect (e.g., Saturn in a nocturnal chart) may cause more difficulties.

temperament.title: 3. Temperament Analysis
temperament.desc: We calculate the dominant temperament of the nativity based on the 4 elements (Fire, Earth, Air, Water) and 4 qualities (Hot, Cold, Dry, Moist). Temperament reveals innate physical, emotional, and behavioral characteristics.
temperament.choleric: Choleric (Fire): Hot and Dry - energetic, impulsive, assertive
temperament.melancholic: Melancholic (Earth): Cold and Dry - pragmatic, stable, introspective
temperament.sanguine: Sanguine (Air): Hot and Moist - sociable, optimistic, adaptable
temperament.phlegmatic: Phlegmatic (Water): Cold and Moist - emotional, empathetic, intuitive

lord.title: 4. Lord of the Nativity
lord.desc: We identify the planet that governs the nativity through a scoring algorithm that considers: essential dignities, Ascendant rulership, Moon rulership, Sun rulership (in diurnal charts), Part of Fortune rulership, and angular planets. The Lord of the Nativity represents central themes and dominant characteristics of the native's life.

comparison.title: Traditional vs. Modern Astrology
comparison.traditional: Traditional: Objective, predictive, based on dignities and dispositions
comparison.modern: Modern: Psychological, interpretive, focuses on archetypes and self-knowledge
comparison.approach: Our approach: We prioritize traditional techniques because they are mathematically defined and empirically tested over centuries, offering greater precision and consistency in interpretations.

swissEph.title: Swiss Ephemeris
swissEph.subtitle: The world's most precise ephemeris library
swissEph.desc1: Swiss Ephemeris is an open-source library developed by Astrodienst AG (Switzerland) that provides ultra-high precision planetary positions. It is the standard tool used by professional astrologers, astronomical researchers, and astrological software developers worldwide.
swissEph.desc2: The library is based on NASA/JPL's JPL DE431 ephemeris (Jet Propulsion Laboratory), the same used in real space missions like Voyager, Cassini, and Mars Rovers. This ensures our calculations have the same reliability level used in space exploration.
swissEph.precisionDesc: Average positioning error < 0.001Â° (less than 1 arcsecond). For comparison, the apparent Moon in the sky is 1800 arcseconds in diameter - our precision is 1800Ã— smaller than that.
swissEph.coverageDesc: Valid calculations from 10,000 BC to 10,000 AD, allowing historical analysis of ancient events and long-term future predictions.
swissEph.jplDesc: Uses the same numerical integration data of the solar system developed by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, including adjustments for Einstein's General Relativity, asteroid gravitational perturbations, and tidal effects.
swissEph.openSourceDesc: Swiss Ephemeris is free software under GPL/AGPL license, allowing anyone to verify algorithms and validate calculations. No "secret algorithms" or "black boxes".
swissEph.validationDesc: Comparisons with real astronomical observations (occultations, eclipses, transits) confirm prediction accuracy. Residual errors are in the order of milliarcseconds.

implementation.title: Implementation Details
implementation.subtitle: Full transparency about our calculation techniques
implementation.placidus: Placidus (default): Most popular system, time-based division
implementation.koch: Koch: Similar to Placidus, popular in Europe
implementation.equal: Equal House: Equal 30Â° division from Ascendant
implementation.wholeSigns: Whole Sign: Traditional Hellenistic system (whole signs)
implementation.planetsList: Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto, North Node (True Node)
implementation.planetsNote: Note: Modern planets (Uranus, Neptune, Pluto) are calculated but not used in traditional dignity and sect techniques (which consider only the 7 classical planets).
implementation.majorAspects: Major: Conjunction (0Â°), Opposition (180Â°), Trine (120Â°), Square (90Â°), Sextile (60Â°)
implementation.orbs: Orbs: 8Â° for major aspects, 3Â° for minor aspects (configurable)
implementation.applying: Applying/Separating: Determined by relative planet speeds
implementation.future1: Part of Fortune and other Arabic Parts calculation
implementation.future2: Fixed stars and their conjunctions with planets
